turns.utterance: My husband has a beard and he shaved it off the other day - I'm not sure I like it, as he's just finally been able to grow a full one.
turns.response: They have been a style for a long time! I wish I could grow a full beard, I can't do it haha.

turns.utterance: Some people think that it's a trait back from the time when humans had hair all over there faces and body like gorillas - getting back to our roots I guess LOL!
turns.response: Wow! I don't believe that, but I can see how people get that interpretation. They have a lot more hair.

turns.utterance: And then you have some religions that say it's essential for males to have full beards and mandate it, like Sikhism
turns.response: Right! I don't know much about Sikhism. I know a lot of the Old Testament people had beards though!

turns.utterance: Very true - it seems in todays' age that there are still places that see it as savage and uncivilized to have a beard, even stereotyping men as dangerous.
turns.response: Right! I think a majority of the population stereotypes people with beards. It seems like they have become very popular in the 21st century though!

turns.utterance: It seems around here most people see it as bestowing virtues on the man, such as wisdom and strength.  It's very accepted where I live.
turns.response: Fascinating. I feel like beards are also associate with people of age and life experiences.
